definition: taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription

sentences.english: Taste buds react to sweet, sour, salty, and bitter. Messages are sent from the taste buds to the areas in the cortex responsible for processing taste.
sentences.chinese: 信號會從味蕾傳送到大腦皮質中負責處理味覺的區域。

sentences.english: The lungs' taste receptors do differ from tongue taste buds.
sentences.chinese: 肺部的味覺感受體和舌頭的味蕾確實不同。

sentences.english: Original oat-fiber flavor is the most memorable nice flavor of loyal customers' taste bud.
sentences.chinese: 原味麥纖是老主顧味蕾中最懷念的好滋味。

sentences.english: In the worst cases it can also damage your taste buds and digestive tract.
sentences.chinese: 最糟糕的是它能破壞你的味蕾和消化管。

sentences.english: Louvre rewards your taste in food.
sentences.chinese: 羅浮宮隨時犒賞您的味蕾。

sentences.english: This wine is bold and rich, featuring mouth-filling flavours of peachy fruit sweetness, intermingling with toasty vanillin oak.
sentences.chinese: 大膽，豐富，甜甜的桃子帶着香草橡木味充滿了味蕾。

sentences.english: Thearoma is delivered straight to your taste buds inside the bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 這樣一來，酒味的芳香可以通過汽泡直達你的味蕾。

sentences.english: Our taste buds allow us to detect sweet and sour, salty and savory, and, of course, bitter.
sentences.chinese: 我們的味蕾使我們能感受出酸甜鹹辣，當然還有苦味。

sentences.english: The richness and intensity of the flavor linger long and harmoniously on the palate.
sentences.chinese: 濃郁緊實的風味於味蕾上綿延留連，和諧而悠長。
它們覆蓋着我們的味蕾。

sentences.english: If you cut back gradually, your taste buds will adapt painlessly.
sentences.chinese: 如果你逐漸減量，那麼你的味蕾就不會難以適應。

sentences.english: Diverses flavours will cross your palate soon as you start drinking it.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你開始飲用，馬上就會喚醒你的味蕾。

sentences.english: The catfish has over 27,000 taste buds .
sentences.chinese: 鮎魚有二萬七千多個味蕾。

sentences.english: As your taste buds become acclimated you can eliminate another yolk.
sentences.chinese: 隨着你的味蕾適應新的味道，你可以去掉另一個蛋黃。

sentences.english: The best solution is to take simple yet delicious food which stimulate our taste bud.
sentences.chinese: 最好能喫些刺激味蕾，簡單易做又美味的東西。

sentences.english: Frozen or pre-packaged foods ruin your taste buds and are often unhealthy.
sentences.chinese: 速凍食品會破壞你的味蕾，而且不健康。

definition: taste/texture (of food)/how food feels in the mouth
leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
umami, one of the five basic tastes (cookery)
to taste a small amount/to sample
great meal fit for dragon's son (idiom); sumptuous banquet
